results.title: Three preschoolers
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Time to grow”.
Case studies of three preschoolers, one middle class, one a twin in a culturally unfamiliar background, and one blind.

results.title: Preschool social development
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discusses developments such as emergence of a sense of morality, need for approval, gender identity, emotional regulation. Importance of adequate attachment experiences is stressed.

results.title: The Preschooler's mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Time to grow”.
Studies the surge in children’s development between ages two and a half and six which Piaget describes as a progression from prelogical to operational logical thinking.

results.title: The typical twos
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Time to grow”.
Three case studies of two year-olds and their parents: Tyler, from a middle class family, Dominic, an American Indian, and Becky, from a low-income single parent family show the tensions between the needs for autonomy and attachment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Time to grow”.

results.title: Risk and resilience
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Time to grow”.
Examines the psychological effect of child abuse on development as an on-going risk. Therapy for abused children and counselling for parents is included.

results.title: I, toddler
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Time to grow”.
Investigates the benefits of secure attachment of toddlers to care givers, allowing growing independence in an emotionally secure environment.

results.title: Language and thinking
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discussion of theories on the learning of language, debating whether the process is innate or learned.

results.title: The First year
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Time to grow”.
This case study of the first year of a child’s life describes her growth and development and how her family, including her three year-old sister, adapt.

results.title: The Infant mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discussion of the theories of Jean Piaget on cognitive development. Interviews with child psychologists who comment on the development of thinking, learning and problem solving.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College

results.title: First adaptations
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Time to grow”.
Outlines the degree to which infants are “pre-adapted” to respond to their environment, to allow survival, growth and learning. Brain development is also demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
